events.message: The insured reported a vehicular collision on Main Street causing moderate damage to the front bumper and hood of the car.
Claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing incident details which included a collision involving another vehicle.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage and oversee the claim process for the car accident.
The claim acknowledgement letter was sent promptly to the customer, confirming receipt of the accident claim.
Request was made for police report, driver’s license copy, photos of vehicle damage, and insurance card for further processing.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including detailed photos and police accident report as per the requirements.
Investigation commenced to assess liability, extent of damages, and verify all documents related to the auto collision.
Investigation completed successfully confirming the insured’s account and establishing fault of the third party driver.
A settlement proposal was sent to the claimant outlining the repair costs coverage and compensation terms.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement amount and clarity on the repair timeline.
The claim was officially approved by underwriting after validation of all reports and customer approval of terms.
Payment was issued promptly to the repair shop covering the agreed settlement amount to fix the vehicle damages.
Final closure of the claim was recorded after confirmation of repair completion and satisfaction from the claimant.
